data.fullContent: Risk management is a set of strategies that help decision-makers make informed choices in a world where risk is an unavoidable and constant factor. Businesses began to use techniques designed to manage financial risks in the early 20th century. Today, risk management encompasses such fields as business, finance, investment, and engineering. In business organizations, risk management involves quantifying risks with the use of financial analysis, as well as quantitative and qualitative risk assessment methods. Risk management techniques can be used to assess the risk of business expansion and assess the impact of emerging technologies on business operations.
